result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Arthur Adkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay court costs and victim/witness surcharge by 07-20-16; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, work crew, AODA treatment and treatment at the VA hospital
Court advised defendant that as a conviction felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 130 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, work crew, AODA treatment and treatment at the VA hospital.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/20/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/20/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/20/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Christopher R Smith in court, defendant Donald Arthur Adkins not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/1/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Ed Borda for Attorney Christopher R Smith in court. Nick Cerwin for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in court with attorney Ed Borda for Christopher R Smith.  Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  
Defendant Donald Arthur Adkins in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
